buri.ddmsence.ddms.security.ism

Class ISMVocabulary

  • Object
    • buri.ddmsence.ddms.security.ism.ISMVocabulary

  • public class ISMVocabulary
extends Object
    Representation of the Controlled Vocabulary enumerations used by ISM attributes.

    In DDMS2.03.03.14.0.1/4.15.0

    Token values are read from the CVEnumISM.xml files accompanying the "XML Data Encoding Specification for Information Security Marking Metadata". They can then be used to validate the contents of the attributes in a SecurityAttributes or NoticeAttributes instance.

    • CVEnumISM25X.xml: tokens allowed in the "declassException" attribute
    • CVEnumISMAtomicEnergyMarkings.xml: tokens allowed in the "atomicEnergyMarkings" attribute (starting in DDMS 3.1)
    • CVEnumISMClassificationAll.xml: tokens allowed in the "classification" attribute
    • CVEnumISMClassificationUS.xml: subset of the tokens allowed in the "classification" attribute
    • CVEnumISMCompliesWith.xml: tokens allowed in the "compliesWith" attribute (starting in DDMS 3.1)
    • CVEnumISMDissem.xml: tokens allowed in the "disseminationControls" attribute
    • CVEnumISMFGIOpen.xml: tokens allowed in the "FGIsourceOpen" attribute
    • CVEnumISMFGIProtected.xml: tokens allowed in the "FGIsourceProtected" attribute
    • CVEnumISMNonIC.xml: tokens allowed in the "nonICmarkings" attribute
    • CVEnumISMNonUSControls.xml: tokens allowed in the "nonUSControls" attribute (starting in DDMS 3.1)
    • CVEnumISMNotice.xml: tokens allowed in the "noticeType" attribute (starting in DDMS 4.0.1)
    • CVEnumISMOwnerProducer.xml: tokens allowed in the "ownerProducer" attribute
    • CVEnumISMPocType.xml: tokens allowed in the "pocType" attribute
    • CVEnumISMRelTo.xml: tokens allowed in the "displayOnlyTo" (starting in DDMS 3.1) and "releasableTo" attribute
    • CVEnumISMSAR.xml: tokens allowed in the "SARIdentifier" attribute
    • CVEnumISMSCIControls.xml: tokens allowed in the "SCIcontrols" attribute
    • CVEnumISMSourceMarked.xml: tokens allowed in the "typeOfExemptedSource" attribute (DDMS 2.0 and DDMS 3.0 only)

    Some of these vocabularies include regular expression patterns.

    Since:
    0.9.d
    Author:
    Brian Uri!

    • Method Detail

      • validateEnumeration

        public static void validateEnumeration(DDMSVersion version,
                                       String enumerationKey,
                                       String value)
                                throws InvalidDDMSException
        Helper method to validate a value from a controlled vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        version - the DDMS Version which maps to the version of ISM you wish to use
        enumerationKey - the key of the enumeration
        value - the test value
        Throws:
        InvalidDDMSException - if the value is not and validation should result in errors

      • getEnumerationTokens

        public static Set<String> getEnumerationTokens(DDMSVersion version,
                                               String enumerationKey)
        Returns an unmodifiable set of controlled vocabulary tokens. This method is publicly available so that these tokens can be used as reference data (for example, a select box on a web form).

        If you wish to use these tokens in that way, you must explicitly call setDDMSVersion() in advance, to ensure that the appropriate set of CVE files is used to look up the tokens, OR you may use the configurable property, icism.cve.customEnumLocation, to force the use of a custom set of CVE files. If neither option is used, the default set of tokens returned will be based on the current value of DDMSVersion.getCurrentVersion().

        Parameters:
        version - the DDMS Version which maps to the version of ISM you wish to use
        enumerationKey - the key of the enumeration
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable set of Strings
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the key does not match a controlled vocabulary

      • enumContains

        protected static boolean enumContains(DDMSVersion version,
                                      String enumerationKey,
                                      String value)
        Checks if a value exists in the controlled vocabulary identified by the key. If the value does not match the tokens, but the CVE also contains patterns, the regular expression pattern is checked next. If neither tokens or patterns returns a match, return false.
        Parameters:
        version - the DDMS Version which maps to the version of ISM you wish to use
        enumerationKey - the key of the enumeration
        value - the test value
        Returns:
        true if the value exists in the enumeration, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on an invalid key

      • getEnumerationPatterns

        protected static Set<String> getEnumerationPatterns(DDMSVersion version,
                                                    String enumerationKey)
        Returns an unmodifiable set of controlled vocabulary regular expression patterns.
        Parameters:
        version - the DDMS Version which maps to the version of ISM you wish to use
        enumerationKey - the key of the enumeration
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable set of Strings

      • usingOldClassification

        public static boolean usingOldClassification(String classification)
        Checks if one of the classifications that existed in DDMS 2.0 but was removed for DDMS 3.0 is being used.
        Parameters:
        classification - the classification to test
        Returns:
        true if it is one of the removed enums, false otherwise

      • getInvalidMessage

        public static String getInvalidMessage(String enumerationKey,
                                       String value)
        Generates a message for an invalid value.
        Parameters:
        enumerationKey - the key of the enumeration
        value - the test value which was invalid
        Returns:
        a String

      • requireValidNetwork

        public static void requireValidNetwork(String network)
                                throws InvalidDDMSException
        Validates the value of a network attribute from the IC-COMMON schema. This check is only relevant in DDMS 4.1, which uses IC-COMMON to create a no-namespace "network" attribute. In DDMS 5.0, "network" is moved into the "virt" XML namespace, and validation of the token is implicit in the schema.
        Parameters:
        network - the network token to test
        Throws:
        InvalidDDMSException - if the network is not a valid token
